com.jgcomptech.tools.authenication

Class SessionManager

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.jgcomptech.tools.events.EventTarget<SessionEvent>
      • com.jgcomptech.tools.authenication.SessionActivator
        • com.jgcomptech.tools.authenication.SessionManager

  • public final class SessionManager
extends SessionActivator
    Manages a single login session to allow a users to login to your application.
    Since:
    1.4.0

    • Field Summary

      • Fields inherited from class com.jgcomptech.tools.authenication.SessionActivator

    • Constructor Detail

      • SessionManager

        public SessionManager(UserManager userManager)
        Creates an instance of the SessionManager. Also creates the sessionLoginSuccess, sessionLoginFailure, multiSessionOpened and multiSessionClosed events.
        Parameters:
        userManager - the User Manager to use for the session

        @Contract(pure=true)
public boolean isLoggedIn()
        Returns true if a user is currently logged in.
        Returns:
        true if a user is currently logged in

      • loginUser

        public boolean loginUser(java.lang.String username)
                  throws java.sql.SQLException
        Logs in a user with the specified username and user role and sets any needed permissions, no password checking is used. Fires sessionOpened event allowing the getUser and getSession methods to be called by the assigned EventHandler.
        Parameters:
        username - the username of the user
        Returns:
        false if username does not exist or if session already exists
        Throws:
        java.sql.SQLException - if user lookup fails

      • logoutUser

        public boolean logoutUser()
                   throws java.sql.SQLException
        Logs out the currently logged in user and clears any set permissions. Fires sessionClosed event allowing the getUser and getSession methods to be called by the assigned EventHandler. NOTE: if user was deleted from the database while logged in, the getUser event method will return null.
        Returns:
        false if username or session does not exist
        Throws:
        java.sql.SQLException - if user lookup fails

      • showLoginWindow

        public boolean showLoginWindow(java.lang.String loginTitle,
                               java.lang.String loginErrorText,
                               boolean retryLoginOnFailure)
                        throws java.security.GeneralSecurityException,
                               java.sql.SQLException
        Shows the login dialog window without setting a window icon. Fires either the sessionLoginSuccess or the sessionLoginFailure event allowing the getUser method to be called by the assigned EventHandler.
        Parameters:
        loginTitle - the title of the login dialog window
        loginErrorText - the error text of the login dialog if the login fails
        retryLoginOnFailure - if true the login dialog will be shown again on failure
        Returns:
        true if user logged in successfully and false if cancel button was pressed or login failed
        Throws:
        java.security.GeneralSecurityException - if error occurs while hashing password
        java.sql.SQLException - if error occurs while accessing the database

      • showLoginWindow

        public boolean showLoginWindow(java.lang.String appIconPath,
                               java.lang.String loginTitle,
                               java.lang.String loginErrorText,
                               boolean retryLoginOnFailure)
                        throws java.security.GeneralSecurityException,
                               java.sql.SQLException
        Shows the login dialog window. Fires either the sessionLoginSuccess or the sessionLoginFailure event allowing the getUser method to be called by the assigned EventHandler.
        Parameters:
        appIconPath - icon path to use for login dialog window
        loginTitle - the title of the login dialog window
        loginErrorText - the error text of the login dialog if the login fails
        retryLoginOnFailure - if true the login dialog will be shown again on failure
        Returns:
        true if user logged in successfully and false if cancel button was pressed or login failed
        Throws:
        java.security.GeneralSecurityException - if error occurs while hashing password
        java.sql.SQLException - if error occurs while accessing the database

      • setOnLoginSuccess

        public void setOnLoginSuccess(EventHandler<SessionEvent> e)
        Sets the event handler that will fire when a user login succeeds. The currently assigned event handler is removed if the parameter is null. The specified event handler is assigned to the sessionLoginSuccess event in the EventManager.
        Parameters:
        e - the event handler

      • setOnLoginFailure

        public void setOnLoginFailure(EventHandler<SessionEvent> e)
        Sets the event handler that will fire when a user login fails. The currently assigned event handler is removed if the parameter is null. The specified event handler is assigned to the sessionLoginFailure event in the EventManager.
        Parameters:
        e - the event handler

      • setOnSessionOpened

        public void setOnSessionOpened(EventHandler<SessionEvent> e)
        Sets the event handler that will fire when the session is opened. The currently assigned event handler is removed if the parameter is null. The specified event handler is assigned to the sessionOpened event in the EventManager.
        Parameters:
        e - the event handler

      • setOnSessionClosed

        public void setOnSessionClosed(EventHandler<SessionEvent> e)
        Sets the event handler that will fire when the session is closed. The currently assigned event handler is removed if the parameter is null. The specified event handler is assigned to the sessionClosed event in the EventManager.
        Parameters:
        e - the event handler
